comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Burton_Harrison Francis Burton Harrison (December 18, 1873 – November 21, 1957) was an American statesman who served in the United States House of Representatives and appointed Governor-General of the Philippines by President of the United States Woodrow Wilson. Harrison was a prominent advisor to a commonwealth president and the first four Presidents of the Philippines. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4332077751/]

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content:
@ Richard Arthur Norton (1958- ),

Do you think that the photograph captioned "F.D. Harrison" (above) is actually F.B. Harrison?

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: I think R.A.N. is right.  Looks like the same guy, and I think the caption on this photo actually is a "B".

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you. I think that we can make the correction to the name in the caption for this photo, and we'll do that next time we update the record. Here's another Bain photo to confirm: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/ggb2004000920.
